Kristina needs a loan to buy a computer and printer, which will help her to make her accounting reports faster and more effectively, and she will save more time for caring for her mother.

loans.use: To buy a computer and printer for her accounting business.

loans.name: Renaissance Group

texts.fr:
Mme LEONIE est la responsable du groupe RENAISSANCE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. Les 03 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter 03 sacs de mil, 01sac d’haricot et 04sacs de maïs.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices.  Mme ambitionne s’acheter un motocycle et étendre les limites de son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. LEONIE represents the group RENAISSANCE. She is doing well. She is the married mother of three children aged 8 to 18 who all attend school. 

LEONIE has been selling cereals for eleven years. She buys her stock in neighboring villages. Her customer base consists of both women and men. 

Leonie plans to buy three sacks of millet, one sack of beans and four sacks of maize. She wants to save her profits. Her goal is to buy an motorcycle and expand her business territory.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of millet, one sack of beans and four sacks of maize.

loans.name: Mariela Elizabeth

texts.es:
La clienta Mariela vive en Libertad. Debido a su situación que tiene un bebe tuvo que buscar la manera  de crear ingresos y de esa manera vio en la venta de ropa  la posibilidad de tener un negocio propio.

Trabaja todos los días en la mañana y en  la tarde.  Su dificultad es su enfermedad. No es casada, tiene una nena que estudia en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo va a comprar tela y ropa. Su sueño es tener un local donde pueda vender su ropa ya que ella también las elabora para mejorar su ingreso y hacer su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Mariela lives in Libertad.  Because she has a baby, she had to look for a way to create income.  This is how she saw that selling clothes was a possibility to having her own business.

She works every day in the mornings and the afternoons.  Her difficulty is her illness.  She is not married, and she has a little girl who attends public school.

She will use the loan to buy fabric and clothes.

Her dream is to have a place where she would be able to sell clothes.  She also makes clothes in order to improve her income and to build her house from cement.

loans.use: to buy fabric and clothes.

loans.name: Sababougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mme AZILA JUDITH  représente le  groupe  SABABOUGNOUMA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est  âgé de 03 ans. L’enfant ne va à l’école et elle a 03 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend du combustible depuis 10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile. Ses clients sont les habitants du quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter  une rangé de combustible.	
Elle  veut  renforcer  son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne  dans l’avenir ouvrir un kiosque et mieux s’occuper  de son enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Azila Judith is the leader of the Sababougnouma group. She is doing well. She is the married mother of a 3-year-old child who does not yet go to school. She supports three people.

Mrs. Azila Judith has been selling fuel for ten years. She gets her supplies delivered to her home. Her customers are locals.

She would like to buy a range of fuel products. She will use her profits to strengthen her business. Her goal is to open a kiosk and better provide for her child.

loans.use: to buy a range of fuel products.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 33-year-old hardworking man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His main business is transport but he also has a banana plantation to earn extra income.

High cost of fuel and unpredictable weather that makes roads impassable are his great challenges.

A good father that he is, he desires to have a decent house and educate his children up to the university.

Moses intends to use the loan to buy household items for his family.

loans.use: To buy household items.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 46-year-old widowed woman with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

She earns a living by dealing in second-hand clothes. Her clients are the people around the railway station. She also does farming.

She hopes to build a permanent house for residence and and educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification.

The seasonal nature of the business poses a challenge to her cash flows, but her dream is to diversify the business to include shoes and office wear.

Betty intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nzerena

texts.en:
Nzerena is a 37-year-old woman with five children, ages 17, 15, 13, 11 and 8, living in Kagadi, Uganda. 

She owns a produce store where she sells maize, cassava and groundnuts. She has been in this business for four years and supplements her earning with income from fish sales. She plans to buy land in future and educate her children despite inadequate capital, which is a major challenge to her business. 

Nzerena is requesting for a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 27 years old with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For 11 years he has been selling local brew, having got start-up capital from his mother. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business. Deo used the previous loan to buy local brew to sell.

With the proceeds from the previous loan, he was able to start a retail shop in order to supplement his income. He dreams of building a permanent home and educating his children. His business plan is to expand to new markets. 

Deo is requesting for a loan to buy general merchandize such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Felicia's Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the group coordinator for El Milagro (The Miracle) 3. This group is composed of five women entrepreneurs. Felicia lives in a rural area near the city of Hato Mayor, a city surrounded by rural areas, because of her agricultural activities. She is a married women with seven children, but only one of them lives with her husband and her. 

Felicia is receiving her 14th loan and she is very excited. She started her business almost eight years ago with her first Esperanza loan. Felicia sells charcoal, meat, fruit, vegetables and other goods, in her stand in front of her home. She will use this loan to buy charcoal, fruit, vegetables, chicken, and beef. She likes to work and to do business and she will use her business profits to expand her business into a grocery store. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy charcoal, fruit, vegetables, chicken, and beef

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, son and two daughters in Berkaber village, which is in the area of Ijevan. As Hasmik has said, to sustain big family in their village is very hard and they work hard day and night in order to meet their family's needs. Hasmik’s husband works for the village as a gardener and her son is a driver. 

Hasmik is engaged in farming and animal breeding. On plot of land near their house, Hasmik grows tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes and peppers, which she sells in the Ijevan markets. At the same time, she breeds cows and pigs in an animal barn which was built by her son and husband. With income from this agricultural business, Hasmik shares her family's monthly expenses with her husband and son.

Hasmik is asking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy two young cows and she hopes to receive a good profit from cattle breeding in the future.

loans.use: to buy two young cows.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 35-year-old hardworking single woman living with two children in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She operates a bar as well as dealing in salt and agriculture produce. She began the business to support herself and her children after she separated from her husband.

With the proceeds she has been able to restock her businesses and provide basics to her family. Grace is requesting a loan to buy beer and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and salt.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Young taxi driver David is 25 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and newborn son in Ijevan city. David’s wife is a chemist and works as an apothecary in Ijevan’s pharmacy and helps her husband to sustain their new created family. 

Since 2010 David has operated a taxi service in his own car in Ijevan city. He has a lot of clients and many transporting orders. David says that his occupation is profitable but the same time hard and difficult. David must be very careful while doing his work because he transports people. 
 
David is asking for a loan from Kiva to repair his car. He wants to have a safer, more comfortable car that allows him to complete his transportation orders on time.

loans.use: to repair his car in order to have a safer and more comfortable vehicle.

loans.name: Shamagha

texts.en:
Shamagha, 59, is a farmer. She lives with her husband and son in Koti village, which is near Ijevan. Her elder son and daughter are married and live with their families away from their parents. 

For more than 20 years, Shamagha worked for her town's government. Now, the only source of Shamagha’s family income is farming and animal breeding. Shamagha and her pensioner husband have been engaged in the agricultural business for many years. In her garden, Shamagha grows tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers and potatoes, which her husband sells in Ijevan's markets. Shamagha also breeds piglets. She has a large barn for pigs near her house and keeps more than 15 pigs. Shamagha is very satisfied by her animal breeding, which allows her to meet her family needs. 

Shamagha needs a loan of 1,000,000 to repair the barn for her piglets. A new, large, comfortable barn will allow her to add the number of pigs that she raises. She hopes to finish the repairing process before the cold season.

loans.use: to repair the barn for her piglets.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a widow with four children living in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To make a living, she manages a business buying and raising piglets for sale. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Remedios joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 which will be used to buy additional piglets to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her piggery, as well as the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
la señora Maria Eva tiene su negocio de venta de comida en el mercado de chinandega desde hace 41 años, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos de estos ninguno depende de ella.

 la señora tramita un financiamiento para compra de granos básicos por quintales para su negocio y se siente bien al ser apoyado por los financiamientos ya que este le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas, su trabajo lo empieza desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde de lunes a domingo. se esfuerza por salir adelante para llevar el sustento de su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Eva has had a business selling food in the Chinandega market for 41 years.  She is a single mother and has 4 children, none of them dependent on her.

Maria Eva is requesting a loan to buy basic foods in large quantities for her business, and feels confident that she will be supported by the loan since it will help her increase her sales.  She works from 5 am until 3 pm Monday - Sunday, and works hard to get ahead and sustain her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business like rice, ingredients, oil, sugar, chicken, beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Adiaratou

texts.fr:
Née en Octobre 1977 à Sikasso, Madame Adiaratou est mariée et mère de 4 enfants et réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Lafiabougou Extension, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de cinq années à cette activité de petit commerce notamment à l’achat vente d’habillements (pagnes wax, tissus, etc.). Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre de façon ambulante dans sa localité où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitées de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement de femmes de ménages et de vendeuses de condiments) pour leurs qualités.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est son premier crédit qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 balles de pagne wax et 2 balles de tissus. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce premier crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiaratou, born in October 1977 in Sikasso, is the married mother of four children. She lives with her husband and their children in a nuclear family in Lafiabougou Extension, a suburb of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having attempted several activities without success, she turned to small trade over five years ago, and she is now buying and selling clothing (wax pagnes, fabrics, etc.). She buys her stock in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) for resale door-to-door in her own district where her merchandise is in high demand due to its quality. Her customer base consists mainly of housekeepers and condiments sellers. 

To better meet the needs of a growing customer base, she joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where she is seeking a first loan to buy two bales of wax pagnes and two bales of fabrics.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA, which she will use to help with household expenses, to pay the loan interests, and to invest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Tamara Betsabeth

texts.es:
La clienta Tarama vive en Guayaquil. Ella empezo su negocio de venta de cosmeticos cuando comenzo a estudiar vendiendo los productos a sus compañeros y familiares. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ventas en la actualidad ella trabaja sola todo el día. 

La dificultad en su negocio es la competencia sobre todo estos productos ya que es una marca reconocida en Latinoamerica que es Yanbal. No es casada, ni tiene hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar esmaltes, cremas y  perfumes. Su sueño es ser profesional y ser una empresaria para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Tamara lives in Guayaquil. She started her business of selling cosmetics when she began her studies. Tamara sells her products to her classmates and relatives. She gradually improved her sales and currently works alone throughout the day.

The difficulty with her business is dealing with the competition since her products are made by Yanbal, a brand that is well known throughout Latin America. Tamara is not married and has no children.

With this loan she will buy nail polishes, crèmes, and perfumes. Her dream is to become a professional and a businesswoman so that she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy nail polishes, crèmes, and perfumes.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Condega  un municipio que está ubicado en la parte norte del departamento de Estelí, conocido como tierra de alfareros por su artesanía y gente trabajadora. 

En una comunidad aledaña conocida como laguna de santa Rosa, Vive el señor Reynaldo con su esposa y sus dos hijos, al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios, él de profesión, agricultor, en granos básicos maíz y frijoles es conocido  como una persona honesta y trabajadora.

Su propiedad tiene un área de 3 manzanas de extensión todas aptas para cultivo.

Recientemente está solicitando un crédito para compra de abono, herbicida más gastos en mano de obra, donde piensa salir beneficiado y darle el mantenimiento correspondiente  a sus cultivos maíz y frijoles.
 
El lleva varios  créditos anteriormente, el impacto y beneficios que tiene él y su familia son de una forma positiva ya que trabajan  su finca a través de siembras agrícolas en cada ciclo,  mejorando su nivel de vida y condiciones económicas con los ingresos obtenidos en cada cosecha realizada.
texts.en:
Condega, a municipality in the North of Estelí department, is known as the 'Land of potters' on account of its handicrafts and the industry of its people.  Very close by lies the community of Laguna de Santa Rosa, which is where Reynaldo lives with his wife and two children.  He is responsible for supporting them all and providing an education for his children.  

A farmer by profession, Reynaldo grows basic grains, such as corn and beans, and is known as an honest and hardworking person.  He owns just over 5 acres of land suitable for cultivation and recently applied for a loan to buy manure and herbicide and to cover other expenses such as paying his workers.  He believes that the loan will prove very useful to him by enabling him to tend his crops properly.  

He has had a number of loans in the past which have had a positive impact on the way he and his family run their farm, allowing them to sow crops during each loan cycle and, as a result, improve their standard of living and financial situation with the income obtained from each successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy supplies (manure and herbicide) and pay his workers

loans.name: Visola

texts.ru: Висола очень трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина. С самых ранних лет она  занималась скотоводством. После занятий в школе она всегда помогала родителям, а данный момент её муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию с целью заработки и Висола сама ведет бизнес. В ведение бизнеса ей помогает ее дочь. Вот уже два месяца как муж не отправляет ей деньги из- за не сезонности работы.   Семья живет только на доходы от животноводства.  У них 3 голов скота, но она хочет, увеличит количества скота и у нее еще есть мечта открыть свою маленькую  ферму.   Она обратилась к ИМОН с целью получение займа для покупки скота. Она надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Visola is a very hard-working and goal-oriented woman. From an early age on, she has been raising livestock. After coming from school, she would always help out her parents. At present Visola’s husband is in the Russian federation as a migrant worker, and Visola manages the business on her own. Her daughter helps her in the business. It has been two months since Visola’s husband was able to send them money since his work is seasonal. The family is supported only through income from raising livestock. They have three heads of cattle, but Visola would like to  buy additional cattle. Her dream is to start her own small farm. She applied to IMON for a loan to buy livestock. She is hoping for your help.

loans.use: to buy cattle for expanding her business.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is 40 years old and lives with his wife, son and daughter in Geghamavan village which is in the Sevan area. After finishing school, Seyran participated in the war with Azerbaijan. During the war he was injured and became disabled. Due to health problems, Seyran has never worked anywhere else.

Seyran and his wife engage in farming. On his own plot of land, Seyran’s wife grows potatoes which he sells in Sevan food markets. They also breed cows, sheep and chicken in their barn. The only source of Seyran’s family income is their agricultural business, so they have to work hard day and night in order to sustain their family. After school lessons Seyran’s children help their parents in farming. 

Seyran confessed that he hates any wars and wants to live in his motherland in peace. He said he is a very happy that with income from his agricultural business he can care for his family. He wants to provide a good future for his children and for this aim he will do his best.

Seyran asks Kiva lenders for a loan to buy fodder for his animals and to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his animals and to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Candelaria works hard to support her family.  She has a seafoods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Candelaria is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell at her stall.

Candelaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 51 years old.  She is married and has six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Corazon has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  Corazon has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Erma

texts.en: Ma.Erma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a candy making business in the Philippines.  Ma.Erma requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her candy making.  She has been in this business for eight years.  In the future, Ma.Erma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy making .

loans.name: Edmun

texts.en:
This is Edmun. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy the needed spare parts for his tricycle. He also used it for the tricycle's maintenance. The loan also helped in his household expenditure. He is continuously working to provide for their everyday expenses.

He would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their Tricycle unit, and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Edmun dreams that his business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 29-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children. The older child is seven years old and the younger one is four. She  owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and beverages. She has been operating a variety store for almost one year. 

Marites requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock items like coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, and condiments. In the the future, Marites would like to expand her business to support her family and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, and condiments

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 49 years old.  She is married and has four children.  With one child in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them. Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  Teresita has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft-drinks and other groceries.  In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan which she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria's dream is for her business to continue to grow and to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes. She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lourdes dreams to have an extension of her food stall and hopes to always have a good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nonato

texts.en:
This is Nonato. He previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories, and for the maintenance of their Tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their Tricycle unit and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Nonato's dream is for his business to grow even more and to have a happy family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts for the maintenance of the tricycle unit.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, tiene una venta de pupusa y bebidas. Vive con su familia, su esposo de 35 años de edad,  sus dos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad, todos trabajan en la misma actividad; el negocio lo realiza a las 6:00 am y hasta lleva a cabo la venta en los buses para obtener más ingresos.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar maíz, arroz, entre otros productos para realizar su actividad; este le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio, ya que en estos tiempos las ventas incrementan. 
Su sueño es tener una parcela de tierra propia para tener una mejor calidad de vida y aportar para los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha has a sales stall where she sells "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) and beverages.  She lives with her family- her 35-year old husband and their two children, who are 7 and 10 years old.  They all work in the same business.  They open for business at 6:00am and continue until they are done selling on the buses, so they can earn more income. 
The loan that Martha is requesting will allow her to buy corn, rice and other products she needs for her business.  This will help her to strengthen her business, as this is a high selling season. 
Martha's dream is to have her own parcel of land to improve her quality of life and provide for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice and other products.

loans.name: Pablo Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Pablo se dedica a la actividad de elaboración de algodón de azúcar y palomitas de maíz este producto lo elabora desde las tres de la mañana para que cuando lleguen sus vendedores ya les tenga listo el producto, estos vendedores salen a vender a todos los barrios de chinandega y a las ferias que se realizan en los municipios.

el señor Pablo se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 7 años, empezó con capital  propio, anteriormente se dedicaba a reparaciones de electrodomésticos y decidió ahorrar para poner su propio negocio, es casado tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo todos ellos  trabajan en el mismo negocio.

 necesita un financiamiento para reparar la maquina con la que elabora los algodones de azúcar y seguir obteniendo sus ganancias.

este producto es deseado por los reyes de los hogares los niños, es un algodón dulce y sabroso, el señor lo hace con azúcar y colorante para que le del el color  lo pone en un palo y lo envuelve en una bolsa con un me cate colgado, luego lo pone en un palo en forma de y y ahí van todos los algodones colgados.
texts.en:
Pablo earns a living making cotton candy and popcorn.  He makes these products starting at 3 a.m. so they're ready when the vendors arrive.  The vendors go out to sell in the neighborhoods of Chinandega and at town fairs.

Pablo has worked in this job for seven years.  He started with his own capital.  Previously he had worked repairing appliances and he decided to save for his own business.  He's married and has four children in his care, all of whom work in the same business.

He needs a loan to repair the machine he uses to make his cotton candy so he can continue earning his profits.

Children, the rulers of the household, desire this product, a sweet and tasty cotton.  The man makes it with sugar and coloring.  He puts it on a stick and wraps it in a bag with a hanging cord.  Then he puts it on a Y-shaped stick, and there goes all the hanging cotton candy!

loans.use: to buy a part for his cotton-candy machine

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the materials needed in her business. The loan helped a lot in the education of her children as well as in their everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like paint, screen and shirts. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes to expand her business and dreams to send all her children to school. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she also finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of raw materials like paint, screen, and shirts.

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Pursat province, Sem supports her family by farming rice. She and her husband also raise piglets to generate additional income. Sem is 45 years old and has one kid. Her business sometimes struggles because she does not have sufficient working capital. 

This is Sem's third loan with VisionFund. The previous two loans have helped her family to have clean, plentiful food. Through her good performance in the previous loans, Sem has been selected to be a group leader for this third loan. She's now leading a group of two female members. Sem will spend her third loan on land plowing for her rice field in the rainy season and strongly hopes the rice will produce good yield so that she can make more profit to help her family improve its living conditions.

loans.use: to spend on plowing farmland.

loans.name: Johanis Isabel

texts.es: Johanis de 27 años de edad habita en el municipio de Soledad con su hijo de 1 año de edad y su cónyuge. Allí se dedica a la actividad comercial, pues vende ropa calzado para damas y caballeros, que trae de la ciudad de Medellín y de Bogotá donde fabrican delicados productos en un acabado inigualable. Ella inició su negocio desde el año 2007,  pues su padre le regaló dinero para que empezara  y su tía ubicada en Medellín, la ayudó con su experiencia, en la ubicación de los mejores proveedores y en el envió de sus pedidos.  Johanis hoy tiene un local comercial y surte a pequeñas misceláneas de  barrio y a clientes que está ubicados en el centro de la ciudad,  en la modalidad de crédito o contado.  Su meta es incrementar sus clientes, para aumentar sus ventas, por eso está acudiendo a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fund ación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará zapatos, camisetas, masculina  y femenina , con las cuales responderá su pedidos tomados en la preventa realizada.  Johanis tiene sueños de prosperidad con su esposo y para su familia, como el de tener su propia casa, por eso diariamente trabajan con el fin de lograr ahorros con los cuales poder  alcanzarlos.
texts.en:
Johanis, 27, lives in the town of Soledad with her one-year-old child and her husband.  She makes a living in sales.  She sells women's and men's clothing and footwear that she gets in the cities of Medellín and Bogotá, where they make delicate products with incomparable finishing touches.

She started her business in 2007 because her father gave her the money to set up.  Her aunt in Medellín helped her with her experience locating the best providers and with submitting her orders.

Today Johanis has a sales locale in the downtown of her city and she stocks small neighborhood stores and customers.  She accepts credit or cash.

Her goal is to increase her customers and her sales, so she's requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she'll buy men's and women's shoes and t-shirts to fill pre-sale orders.

Johanis dreams of prosperity with her husband and for her family, such as having her own house.  This is why they work every day to be able to save the money to realize their dreams.

loans.use: to buy shoes and t-shirts for men and women

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 49 years old and married with two children.

Clara works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Clara has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Clara aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, a 49-year-old resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She has children and she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Victoria has a dishwashing liquid business. She buys the ingredients and mixes them to make a dishwashing liquid. She then puts them into bottles, retails the bottles and distributes to some variety stores. She also sells the dishwashing liquid to her neighbors and in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 6,000 in sales weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy bottles and ingredients for the dishwashing liquid. 

Victoria hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a loving and healthy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for bottles and ingredients of dishwashing liquid.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old and married with 2 children. With 1 child in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for her family.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and school supplies. 

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money to build a grocery store at public market.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Katty Beatriz

texts.es:
La clienta Katty vive en Guayaquil.  Ella escogió tener un pequeño negocio de papeleria por falta de empleo ya que es madre soltera. En la actualidad ella trabaja todos los dias vendiendo papeleria, utiles escolares y sus hijos le ayudan cuando ella esta ocupada. 

El negocio que ella también vende productos por catalogo como cosmeticos. Su dificultad es la delincuencia q hay en el sector donde ella tiene su negocio.

Es soltera. Tiene dos hijos q estudian en escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrina y mercadería. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande y estable.
texts.en:
Katty lives in Guayaquil. She chose to open a small stationery business because she did not have a job. Katty is a single mother. She currently works every day by selling stationery and school supplies. Her children help out whenever she is busy.

Katty also sells cosmetics through catalogs from her business. Her difficulty is dealing with the crime that exists in the area where her business is located. Katty is single and her two children attend a state school.

With this loan, Katty will buy a display cabinet and merchandise. Her dream is to have a large and stable business.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and merchandise for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and she works hard to support her family.

Esther has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transport. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like biscuits, sardines and other groceries for her general store business.

Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Gigina

texts.en:
Gigina is 46 years old and married with 4 children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gigina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Gigina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Aîssata

texts.fr:
Madame Aîssata a environ 48 ans et est mère de six enfants, elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye extension, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso.
Madame Aîssata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est finalement initié à cette activité de d’achat et de vente des poissons fumés depuis plus de vingt ans. Elle achète ses poissons fumés à Mopti sur commande auprès de ses parents et qui seront ensuite revendus au grand marché et les jours de foire. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité des poissons présentés. 
Elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel après avoir correctement remboursé es trois prêts précédents.    
Avec ce quatrième prêt, elle compte acheter 20 cartons des poissons fumés de qualités différente.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA. Ces bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.  
Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante au niveau du marché.
texts.en:
Aïssata is around 48 years old and mother to six children. She lives with her husband and their children in a nuclear family in Hamdallaye Extension, one of the districts in the outskirts of the town of Sikasso. After a number of unsuccessful business ventures, Aîssata finally launched herself into buying and selling smoked fish over 20 years ago. She buys her smoked fish by order from her parents in Mopti and then resells them at the Grand Market and on fair days. She is in great demand from her customers for the quality of the fish she presents. 

She is on her fourth individual loan having repaid three previous loans in full. With this fourth loan she is planning to buy 20 cartons of smoked fish of varying quality. With this loan she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 150,000FCFA. These profits will enable her to contribute to the family expenses and pay the interest on her loan; the balance will be invested in her activity.

Aîssata's ambition is to become a significant trader in the market.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and perishables

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the materials needed in her tailoring business. It also helped in her other businesses like in her tricycle transport business and in her fruit and vegetable vending. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy raw materials such as fabric, cloth and thread for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and provide for her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she also finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials such as fabric, cloth and thread for her business.

loans.name: Liezelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Liezelda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products. Liezelda is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Liezelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Srey Oun's Group

texts.en:
Srey Oun is single and aged 21 years. She lives in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province and supports herself by farming rice and raising piglets for sale. She sometimes lacks working capital to do business. 

Srey Oun has been appointed as a group leader and represented her group in applying for a second loan from VisionFund. The first loan enabled her to have good and clean food for her daily living. Srey Oun will use her portion of this second loan to buy more piglets and pig feed, in the hopes that the pigs will be healthy and able to be sold for good money.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzviminda hopes that her business will get bigger and dreams that her family will live happily with contentment. She meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 50 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lydia has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years. 

Lydia is requesting a loan from NWTF for 24,000 PHP, which she will use to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
El señor Félix habita en la cuidad de Managua se dedica a laborar como guarda de seguridad en una empresa desde hace 30 años.

Debido a que se acerca la temporada de invierno y el techo de su vivienda está en mal estado necesita un crédito para repararlo por esta razón esta solicitando un crédito a ceprodel para llevar acabo su objetivo con el que piensa compra zinc, perlines,
Pide el apoyo a los inversionistas de kiva para poder mejorar su casita.
texts.en:
Félix lives in the city of Managua. He has made a living working as a security guard at a business for the last 30 years.

Because the winter season is coming and the roof of his home is in bad shape, he needs a loan to repair it. For this reason he is asking for a loan from CEPRODEL to carry out his objective, with which he thinks to buy metal beams and roofing tiles. He asks for the support of Kiva investors to be able to improve his little house.

loans.use: to buy metal beams and roofing tiles

loans.name: Alma Muriel

texts.es:
Alma, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo y así poder seguir invirtiendo en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar gas, leña, maíz, entre otros productos necesarios para realizar la actividad.
El crédito anterior le genero aumento en las ganancias, logro cancelar algunas deudas que poseía y asimismo cubrir los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Alma requests a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her business.  It will make it possible for her to buy gas, firewood and corn, among other products needed to carry out her activity.

The previous loan generated increased profits.  She succeeded in paying off some debts she had as well as in covering her household expenses.  Her economic conditions and family situation have improved.

loans.use: to buy gas, firewood and corn, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 51 years old, a widow with five children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell at her store.

Nenita has been in her business for thirteen years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Nenita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Nenita aspires to save enough money to build a restaurant at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilia Glory

texts.en: Lilia Glory is engaged in the vending business of charcoal and feed in her community.  Together with her husband, they work hand in hand to improve their way of living for their three children.  Despite financial difficulty, they have a strong determination to improve their business.  To make her business grow, Lilia Glory is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 from the Kiva lenders through ASKI to buy more stocks of charcoal and feed to sell. She is hoping that the lenders will support her in this loan as it will really be of great help in her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal and feed to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 49 years old, a married mother of five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Rita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gavino

texts.en:
Gavino is a hard-working father who is engaged in the hog raising business.  He dreams to uplift his family's status of living to further provide the growing needs of his family.  They live in a rural community where planting and harvesting rice and vegetables are the main source of income.  

Gavino wanted to maintain his business, and this made him request to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders through ASKI; an amount of PHP 16,000.  This will be used to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He is hoping that someday, he will make more improvements to his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Marigrace

texts.en:
This is Marigrace. Her previous loan helped her in her business in buying the needed grocery items for her variety store. The loan also helped in the education of her children as well as in their everyday expenses. Six years into the business, she continues to work hard together with her husband who is a security guard to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another PHP 40,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marigrace dreams that her children will finish their studies and hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is is 54 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last ten years by selling home and used products. She earns PHP 10,000 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She joined GDMPC in 2012 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun and her family live in a wooden house located in one of the districts of Pursat province. She is 32 years old and married with three little girls.

Saroeun raises piglets and chickens for sale while her husband makes money by constructing houses.  Saroeun after successfully repaying her second loan, applied for another loan from VisionFund.  She plans to get the money to buy more piglets and chickens for raising and selling.  She will use the remaining money to buy construction materials for her husband's small business. 

Saroeun hopes that this third loan will allow her to make more profit and also expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, chickens and construction materials.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 49 years old and married with ten children.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has three children who are still in school.

Marina has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. Marina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her basket weaving .

Marina has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Marina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Laylanie

texts.en:
This is Laylanie. She previously accessed a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Laylanie dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from studing the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Natanael

texts.es:
Natanael tiene 34 años de edad, tiene tres hijos. Desde muy pequeño junto a su padre aprendió el trabajo agrícola, cultivando la tierra a pesar que le falta la mano derecha ese no es impedimento para trabajar y querer superarse cada día más. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar foliares, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para su cultivo de sandia y posteriormente sembrara maíz. Lo que busca él, es que a su familia no le falte nada y que sus tres hijos puedan terminar sus estudios y que cumplan sus sueños.
texts.en:
Natanael is 34 years old and has three children. He learned how to farm from his father as a very young child. He has been working the land since then, in spite of his missing his right hand. This doesn't stop him from working and wanting to improve himself more and more.

He will use the loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo to buy foliar and soil fertilizers and pay for labor for his watermelon crops. He will later plant corn. His goal is for his family not to want for anything and for his three children to be able to finish school and follow their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase soil and foliar fertilizers, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: Don jose de 44 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años siembra maíz y sorgo con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con su familia. don jose solicita un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos herbicidas fertilizates, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia que es donde siembra sus cultivos para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
José, 44, lives with his wife and two children in a house of his own.  He has worked in agriculture for 20 years growing corn and sorghum and uses profits obtained from his sales to move ahead with his family.

José is requesting a loan to be able to buy farm supplies like manure, herbicide, fertilizer, etc. to improve the land shown in the photograph which is where he grows his crops to earn higher profits to provide his family with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Elmer Javier

texts.es: Don Elmer de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a trabajar de mecanico industrial desde hace 28 años con las ganancias de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Elmer desea mejorar su vivienda poniendo las ventanas, puertas y el techo  pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por eso solicita un crédito para poder comprar laminas, hierro, balcones,  y pago de mano de obra, y asi el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Elmer, 47, lives in his own house with his wife and son.  He has worked as an industrial mechanic for the last 28 years and uses profits from his work to cover some of his household expenses.  

Elmer would like to improve his house installing windows, doors and roofing but what he earns isn’t enough to be able to do so which is why he’s asking for a loan to be able to buy metal sheeting, iron rods, balconies and to pay labor costs so he and his family can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Lalaine has been in this business for three years. Lalaine earns extra income from selling coconut wine.

Lalaine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rolando Antonio, técnico en refrigeración, realiza trabajos a domicilios de reparación de aires acondicionados y refrigeradora. De su trabajo provienen sus ingresos.

 Solicita el  préstamo a ceprodel para comprar herramientas de trabajo, para realizar mejor su trabajo, y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.

  Agradece  a  ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en el, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su actividad  de forma que esto le permitirá llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en: Rolando Antonio earns his living by providing home repair service for air conditioners and refrigerators. He has applied to Ceprodel for a loan to buy work tools to do his job and service his clients better. He thanks Ceprodel and Kiva for this opportunity and their confidence in him. He will use the loan to invest in his work so that he can support his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Almoustapha

texts.fr:
Né en  Juillet 1978 à Kafouziela Cercle de Sikasso, Monsieur  Almoustapha est marié et père de trois enfants. Il réside avec sa famille dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Almoustapha  après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au métier de soudeur il y’a maintenant quatre ans. Il achète des tôles et des ferrailles pour en faire des objets de différentes sortes (portes, fenêtres, chaises, etc.) qui seront vendus dans son atelier à Sikasso, sur la route RN7,  au comptant et souvent à crédit. Il est beaucoup sollicité et les commandes de ses clients ne cessent d’augmenter mais ses ressources propres sont insuffisantes pour mieux satisfaire les attentes de sa clientèle. 
Ainsi pour palier ces problèmes, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt. Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 5 tôles noires, 5 tôles en Z, 6 tôles en U et 2 tonnes de ferrailles.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce crédit un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 110 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Almoustapha was born in July 1978 in Kafouziela, Sikasso Cercle. He is the married father of three children, and he lives with his family in a large traditional family in Hamdallaye, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having attempted several activities without success, he learned the profession of welder four years ago. He buys scrap metal that he turns into all sorts of custom pieces (doors, windows, chairs, etc.) and sells out of his shop on route RN7 in Sikasso, for cash, sometimes on credit. He is in high demand and orders are steadily increasing, but his supplies of raw materials are not sufficient to meet customer demand. To remedy this hurdle, he joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where he is now seeking a second loan. The first loan was correctly repaid. 

He plans to buy five pieces of black sheet metal, five Z- shaped sheets, six U-shaped sheets, and two tonnes of scrap. 

He expects to earn an average monthly profit of 110,000 FCFA, which he will use to help with household expenses, to pay the loan interests, and to invest in his activity.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for metal working.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Macrina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Macrina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more snack foods to sell to her customers.

Macrina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Macrina would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is married and has six children. She works hard to support her family. Aileen has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from running a general store. 

Aileen is requesting her seventeenth loan from NWTF for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy tools and equipment for her tricycle. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for her tricycle.

loans.name: Geraldina Carolina

texts.es:
La Señora Geraldina es originaria del municipio de san Rafael del sur, es contadora trabaja de lunes a viernes, y tiene una panadería de repostería que trabaja los fines de semana haciendo pastel, repostería  situada en su casa de habitación, trabaja con su mama.

Es casada su esposo trabaja como conductor en una empresa de recorridos, tienen una hija menor de edad en edad escolar.

La señora con los ingresos de su negocio y parte de los ingresos del esposo compraron una finca pequeña donde siembran hortalizas y maíz.

Necesita el financiamiento para la compra de insumos de fertilizantes para la siembra de este cultivo y otra parte para repellar una pared de su habitación.

Es una joven luchadora con muchos deseos de superación de vivir mejor tener su propia casa bien terminada. Ya que con todos los financiamiento que se le han otorgado y ahorros ha podido construir su casa y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Geraldina is from the city of San Rafael del Sur. She works as an accountant Monday to Friday. She has a bakery in her house where she makes pastries with her mother on weekends. Her husband drives for a transportation company, and they have a school-age daughter. With her income and some money from her husband, they bought a small farm where they grow vegetables and corn. She needs a loan to buy fertilizer for this planting season and to plaster a wall in her room.

Geraldina is a fighter and has a great desire to live a better life in her own house, which is almost finished. They have been able to build their house and give their family a better life through loans and their savings.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to plant vegetables and to buy building materials.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
la señora Rosa Amelia tiene un negocio en el mercado de chinandega desde hace  9 años, es madre de dos niñas  ambas van a la escuela, se esfuerza por sacarlas adelante, trabaja de lunes a domingo para llevar el sustento  a su hogar.

 la señora Rosa empezó su negocio con capital propio, antes de tener su tramo de ropa vendía ambulante delantales, estos lo usan la mayoría de las comerciantes en la parte de adelante para no ensuciarse la ropa que ella andan y hecha el dinero en sus bol sitas, la señora con esfuerzo ha logrado mantener su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia has had a business in the Chinandega market for nine years. She is the mother of two girls who both go to school and she works hard to get them ahead. She works Monday-Sunday to provide for her household. 

Rosa began her business with her own capital. Before having her own clothing stall she sold aprons on foot. These are used by the majority of merchants so that they don't get their clothing dirty and to keep their money in the pockets. 

This woman has been able to maintain her business and improve her standard of living with her own efforts.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, underwear, socks, briefs and camisoles.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura y desde hace 15 comercializa con ganado. Él es un hombre responsable y dedicado a su familia, es pastor evangélico. El ganado lo compra cada ocho días y cuando le sale una buena oferta. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para preparar la tierra en donde cultivara, pago de mano de obra y para comprar ganado. De esta manera, podrá continuar con su negocio y cultivara en el tiempo oportuno. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien en la universidad para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan, 35, is married and has three children.  He’s worked in agriculture for the last 20 years and for the last 15 has been selling livestock.  He’s a responsible man who is devoted to his family; he’s an evangelical pastor.  He buys livestock every eight days and whenever a good deal presents itself.

The loan he’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to prepare the land for planting, to pay labor costs and to buy livestock.  In this way, he will be able to stay in business and to plant in an opportune time frame.  His dream is that his children attend university so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy livestock and to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Imperio Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento Imperio está  compuesto por diez  integrantes ocho mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Ramona  tiene 35 años,  tiene tres hijos de las edades de 5, 7 y 11 años, ella se dedica a la construcción de puertas y muebles junto a su esposo quien es carpintero, la Sra.  Ramona  tiene su carpintería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Cenetrop de la ciudad de Santa Cruz  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya 15 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también era carpintero,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Ramona  utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de madera para la construcción de puertas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material de trabajo, ya que sin esto no podría realizar puertas la Sra.  Ramona  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “Imperio” (Empire) communal bank has ten members: 8 women and two men.  The bank president is Ramona, 35.  She has three children aged 5, 7, and 11 years.  She works building doors and furniture with her husband who is a carpenter.  Ramona’s carpentry shop is located in the city of Santa Cruz’s Cenetrop zone.  She’s been in this line of work for 15 years already having learned the occupation from her father who was also a carpenter.

This loan will be her first sequence in the institution and Ramona will use it to buy lumber to build doors.  The reason for requesting this loan is the lack of capital needed to buy this work material because without it Ramona would be unable to manufacture the doors.  

The business challenge Ramona faces is to move out of poverty.  She will use profits to improve her quality of life since this is the only activity she has that makes it possible for her to support herself and her family.  Because of this, she feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Rith's Group

texts.en:
Rith is married and a mother of eight children, some of whom are still in school. Rith makes a living by farming rice, while her husband is a laborer. Their family lives in an old wooden house which is located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. 

Rith is now leading her other female group member to apply for another loan from VisionFund. The previous two loans have helped her business well. This time, Rith is requesting the loan in order to renovate her house. She wishes to have a proper and decent house for her family to live in.

loans.use: For home renovation

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Mildred works hard to support her family. She has a business of selling appliances in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales and raising livestock. Mildred is borrowing 50,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more appliances to sell to customers.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more appliances to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mecilinda

texts.en:
Mecilinda is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is 44 years old and is happily married to Henry who works as a seaman. God has blessed them with loving children all whom are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Mecilinda owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside one's house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a 5PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and others. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price and then she sells it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passers-by and the people in the community. She earns 300 PHP a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be of great help to her to add more products to her store.

Mecilinda desires that her business will continue to grow and she is hoping to have more customers. She hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a frozen food business in the Philippines. She is requesting her second loan from NWTF for 19,500 PHP, which she will use to buy more frozen food to sell in her food stall. With this loan, she hopes to further build her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase frozen food to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ventura Jose

texts.es:
El señor trabaja prestando servicios  a la poblacion en general desde hace 6 años con su triciclo, es casado y padre de un niño que esta en edad escolar en secundaria, por el que se esfuerza para sacarlo adelante, trabaja de lunes a domingo.

solicita un financiamiento para reparar el triciclo y brindarle mejores condiciones a sus clientes, el ha mejorado su condición de vida en su hogar, es un joven que le gusta trabajar  y sacar adelante a su hijo, antes de tener su propio negocio el se dedicaba a trabajar como ayudante de albañilería,  con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio compro su triciclo, quiso tramitar el financiamiento para mejorar su triciclo y llamar mas la atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ventura Jose works with his tricycle, providing services to the population in general as he has for the last 6 years. He is married and the father of a school-aged boy in secondary school, for whom he strives to get ahead. He works Monday to Sunday.

He asks for financing to repair his tricycle and to provide better conditions to his clients. He has improved his quality of life in his home. He is a young man who likes to work and get his son ahead. Before having his own business he made a living by working as a mason's assistant. With a lot of effort and sacrifice, he bought his tricycle. He wanted to use the financing to improve his tricycle and to call the attention of his clients more.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his tricycle, like paint, tires, and a canopy for the roof

loans.name: Cruz Gladis

texts.es: Doña Cruz de 31 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. y poder mejorar su terreno que muestra la fotografia donde siembra sus cultivos. Doña Cruz tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Cruz is 31 and lives with her two children in their own house. She grows corn and beans. She has garnered much experience from her years of farming that has helped her achieve better harvests. She sells her crops on the outskirts of the community and has many customers who buy from her because she offers quality, good prices, and good service. 

She has applied for a loan to invest in her business by buying corn and bean seeds, pesticide, weed killer, and more and by improving her cropland, which is shown in the photo. Cruz has established credit references and is very responsible. She is sure she will be able to pay her loan on time and bring her family financial security.

loans.use: to improve her land and to buy manure, fertilizer, seed, and more.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 21 years old and single. He is a carpenter and operates a small carpentry workshop, which is a profitable business and his only source of income.
