loans.use: to buy merchandize such as umbrellas, saucepans, frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su esposa y su hija de 6 meses en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente solicita un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda y comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, entre otras cosas que le serviran para su cosecha y asi obtendrá mejores ganancias para tener una mejor vida con su familia
texts.en:
The client lives with his wife and six-month-old daughter in his own house.

He has made a living in agriculture for several years.  With the profits from his sales he manages to pay some of his household expenses.

The client's requesting a loan to be able to improve his house and buy agricultural inputs such as soil amendments, fertilizer, herbicide, and other things for his harvest.  This way he'll earn better profits and have a better life with his family.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella tiene un negocio de salon de belleza desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia trabaja todos los dias tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. La clienta solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, tientes para el cabello entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica
texts.en:
The borrower lives with her husband and children.  For several years she has been running a beauty salon out of her home where she works every day and attends to many customers due to her good work.  With the profits she earns and the help from her husband she is able to cover household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy products for the beauty salon such as conditioners, shampoos, hair pins, scissors, hair color and other items she needs to improve her earnings and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: To buy shampoos, hair color, conditioners, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa de su suegra con su compañera de vida y su hija de 2 años de edad, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes asi como muestra la fotgrafia y poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
The client has been farming for several years, which has given him the ability and knowledge to take care of his crops. He mainly plants corn and beans, which he sells to commercial grain buyers close to his home. The profits from his sales help pay family expenses. 

He lives with his life partner and two-year-old daughter in his mother-in-law's house. He has applied for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like manure, seed, and fertilizer, as shown in the photo, to plant his crops so that he can earn more income and continue to help pay household expenses.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, manure, pesticide, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de trabajo. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de un año de edad, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra maioz y frijol. el cliente desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y poder mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The client is a very responsible man where his work obligations are concerned. He currently lives with his wife and his one-year-old son. He makes a living as a farmer, planting corn and beans. The client wants to increase his sales and so he visited the offices of INTEGRAL to ask for a loan that will permit him to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, among other things, and to be able to improve the land he plants on, which is shown in the photograph. He hopes to count on the help requested as he does not have any other monetary income. He will thus keep bringing home the daily bread without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to improve the land

loans.name: Fauto

texts.es:
El señor Fauto vive en un  barrio de la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, actualmente trabaja para el estado desempeñándose en el cargo de higienista desde hace tres año, es una persona honesta, con bueno valores morales  responsable, casado con dos hijo a su cargo y su esposa lo apoya en el cuido de sus niños ya que es ama de casa.
  
se presento a ceprodel don Fauto a solicitar un crédito para construir un anexo de un cuarto, con este crédito comprara materiales como bloque cinc, cemento, arena.

Con este  financiamiento lo invertirá en ampliar su vivienda y darle una mejor comodidad y condición de vida  a su familia, porque sin este apoyo que brinda kiva a través de ceprodel no podría hacer estas mejoras.
texts.en:
Fauto lives in a suburb of the city of Managua, Nicaragua. He has been working for the city as a hygienist for three years. He is an honest person, of good moral values, responsible, and married with two children in his care and his wife supports him in the care of their children as she is a housewife.

Fauto came to Ceprodel to ask for a loan in order to build an extension to a room. He will use the loan to buy materials such as blocks, zinc, cement and sand.

With this funding he will invest by expanding his home to offer better comfort and living conditions to his family, because without this support that Kiva offers through Ceprodel he could not make these improvements.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Margarita Del Rosario

texts.es: Margarita de 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos. ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años. Sus vecinos dan buenas referencias tanto de su trabajo como de su persona. Margarita desea ampliar más su negocio es por esta razón que se decidió en hacer un prestamo con el fin de incrementar su inventario .El crédito que solicita es para comprar variedad de productos de tienda tales como: maíz, arroz, aceite, frijoles, golosinas, bebidas, etc. ya que desea incrementar sus ingresos de tal forma que pueda ofrecer a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en: Margarita, who is 44, lives in her own home with her two children.  She has been running a small shop in her home for a number of years.  Her neighbours hold her in high esteem both as a businesswoman and as a person. Margarita wants to extend her business and so she decided to seek a loan to increase her stock.  She is seeking the loan to buy a range of products such as corn, rice, oil, beans, sweets, drinks etc., which will enable her to boost her income and, in turn, provide better life chances for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, eggs, beans etc

loans.name: Inocente Everilda

texts.es: Doña inocente vive con sus dos hijos, su madres y sus hemanos en casa propia ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 6 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes Doña inocente como toda buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Inocente tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Inocente lives with her two children, her mother, and her siblings in her own house.

She has a store where she sells necessities: beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other things.  She has had the business for six years and it has given her experience in sales, which allows her to get the best profits.  The store's located in her house in a very busy area.  She has acquired a lot of customers because she has the best-stocked store.  People prefer her because she always has what they need: quality products, affordable prices, and incomparable customer service.

Like all good merchants, Inocente wants to expand her business and make a new investment, but she needs capital.  This is why she's asking Integral for a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.

Inocente has a good payment record.  She's certain she'll pay back the debt and trusts she'll give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, beverages, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Ana se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos de madera, plástico  y artesanías en el mercado  de chinandega desde hace 25 años.

 es madre de cinco hijos  tres de estos en edad escolar, es casada, su esposo le brinda ayuda en la elaboración de productos de madera ya que tienen un pequeño taller en su casa y el elabora los roperos, miluso, chineros etc,

 y luego la señora Ana los vende en el mercado. también la señora elabora piñatas para su negocio, las vende en su tramo y con la ayuda de sus hijos los mayores elabora las piñatas. la señora se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus hijos, para que estos sean jóvenes que muy buenas expectativas para el futuro. 


solicita un financiamiento para compra de mercadería para su negocio y seguir obteniendo ganancias y de estas ir mejorando su calidad de vida en su hogar. 

ella se siente muy agradecida con ceprodel y con kiva ya que a esta señora la han visitado en varias ocasiones y sabe perfectamente que gracias a kiva y a ceprodel su negocio ha evolucionado bastante.
texts.en: Ana has been selling wooden and plastic products and handicraft items in Chinandega market for 25 years.  She is married and is the mother of five children, three of whom are of school age.  Her husband helps her to make wooden products, such as wardrobes, multipurpose objects and china cabinets, in the small workshop which they have in their home.  She, then, sells them at the market.  Ana, with the help of her older children, also makes piñatas (traditional decorations) to sell on her stall. She works tremendously hard to support her children and give them good prospects for the future.  She is seeking a loan to buy merchandise for her business and to continue making profits which she can use to improve the quality of her home life.  She is very grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for visiting her and she knows very well that it is thanks to their help that her business has developed considerably.

loans.use: to buy handicraft items, cushions, baskets, coat hangers and pillows

loans.name: Jimmy Alexander

texts.es:
Jimmy Alexander vive en la cuidad Managua trabaja  como operario  en la alcaldía desde hace cuatro años se caracteriza por ser un joven responsable en su trabajo  y con su familia.

Jimmy está solicitando crédito a kiva para la compra de materiales de construcción como piedra, arena ,cemento , para  hacerles un anexo a su vivienda  para darles mayor comodidad y seguridad  a su familia
texts.en: Jimmy Alexander lives in Managua, where he has been working at the town hall for the past four years. He is a responsible young man, both at work and in family matters. Jimmy is asking Kiva for a loan to purchase construction supplies - such as stone, sand, cement - in order to build an annex to his home, so that his family can have a safer and more comfortable home.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Asociacion Aadesco Group

texts.es: El Comité de Agua potable y Saneamiento (CAPS) AADESCO, liderado por el señor Felipe se encuentra ubicado en el valle de la laguna de apoyo de Masaya, Nicaragua, el pozo de agua tiene 20 años de operación, abasteciendo a mas de 480 usuarios de la comunidad del valle de la Laguna. La junta directiva del CAPS está solicitando su segundo crédito para invertir en el mantenimiento del panel de control, bomba y motor y la compra de materiales para la reparación de las oficinas de atención a usuarios como pinturas, puertas y ventanas para dar seguridad a las oficinas. Todos los usuarios contribuirán con el pago del préstamo mediante el pago de las facturas de agua a tiempo.
texts.en:
The AADESCO Water and Sanitation Committee (CAPS) led by Felipe is located in Valle de La Laguna, which supports Masaya, Nicaragua.  The well located here has been in operation for 20 years and provides service to more than 480 users in the community of Valle de La Laguna.  The Board of Directors of CAPS is requesting its second loan so that it can invest in the maintenance of the control panel, pump, and motor.  Materials such as paint, doors, and windows will also be purchased to repair the user services offices in order to provide security.  

All of the users will contribute to the payment of this loan, which will be funded by water invoice payments that have been received on time.

loans.use: to buy paint, doors, and windows for repairing the committee offices and to pay for the maintenance of the well control panel, pump, and motor.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, 53 years old, is from the village of Ugad in the province of Isabela. She is a woman with determination who always makes sure that she can provide for the daily basic needs of her family. She has managed a hog-raising business for eight years. She wants her business to grow, so she would like to borrow a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from Kiva lenders through ASKI. This will be used for having enough supply of feeds and additional piglets to raise. Maria is hoping that she can expand her business so her family can have a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional piglets for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Eva

texts.en:
Ma. Eva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke-rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her videoke business.

Ma. Eva successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her videoke-rental business.

NWTF is featuring Ma. Eva's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her videoke business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, shirts, blouses, sandals, underwear, socks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is asking for this loan to buy sacks of charcoal so that she can fill all the orders she has and thus, increase her income. She is requesting a loan to buy coal to fill customer orders. She gives thanks to Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva lenders for the opportunity to be given access to loans.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
la señora Cándida se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos como cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos de diferentes lineas estos productos ella los vende al contado y al crédito, tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad desde hace 4 años. vende ambulante, ella busca a sus clientes para ofrecerle producto y estos se los pagan en efectivo o al crédito en dos pagos.

la señora inicio su negocio con aporte de su esposo anteriormente se dedicaba a su hogar como ama de casa, y ya no quiso seguir y el esposo le brindo ayuda para iniciar con su negocio empezó con un capital de c$ 3000 tiene una hija en edad escolar que es la razón por la que lucha por sacarla adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cándida dedicates herself to the sale of products by catalog, such as cosmetics, perfumes, creams, and various lines of treatments.

She sells them for cash and on credit, and she has four years experience in this work. She is a traveling sales person; she looks for her customers to offer them products, and they pay her either in cash or on credit in two installments.

She began her business with her husband's support. Before that, she was a homemaker. When she didn't want to continue doing that, her husband helped her start her business with c$ 3000 in capital.  She has a school-age daughter who is her reason for fighting to get ahead.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics and perfumes from Origlame, Zermat, and Avon to resell.

loans.name: Bernarda De Lourdes

texts.es: la señora Bernarda tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación en una de las comarcas de chinandega, la señora es madre soltera, tiene a su cargo a un hijo que tiene discapacidades( síndrome de daonsw), ella lucha por salir adelante, su pulperia la habré desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, la señora da crédito y recupera la plata los treinta y quince de cada mes, sus mayores clientes son los estudiantes que llegan al zeta una escuela que esta a 20 varas  de su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bernarda runs a small grocery out of her home in one of the regions of the department of Chinandega.  Bernarda is a single mother of a son with special needs (Down Syndrome). She fights to get ahead, and she keeps her grocery shop open from 5:00am until 5:00pm. 

Bernarda allows her customers to pay on credit, and collects the money on the fifteenth and thirtieth of the month. Her best customers are the students who arrive at "The Zeta," a school about twenty yards from her home.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for her small grocery shop, such as sugar, rice, oil and caramels.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: la señora Juana Francisca se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de repostería y refrescos ambulante, es madre soltera, cuatro hijos, ninguno a su cargo, en la actualidad cuenta con un triciclo y una pequeña vente-sita, la señora se ha esforzado por salir adelante, antes se dedicaba a lavar y planchar ajeno, y con capital propio decidió poner su negocio y tener sus propios ingresos.
texts.en: For 20 years, Juana Francisca has dedicated herself to selling sweets and soft-drinks through traveling sales. She is a single mother of four children, none of whom are in her care. Currently, she relies upon a tricycle and a small sales location.  Juana has driven herself to get ahead. Before, she worked by washing and ironing for others. With an investment of her own capital, she decided to start her business and make her own income.

loans.use: purchase goods for her business, including cases of eggs; perishables like tomato, onion, pepper, and soups; and trinket jewelry.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing needs for her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing needs for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth's business has had a prime moment over the last one year. The sales have been high, and this enabled her to meet the required repayments besides supporting her family. The rentals have also proved a constant source of income.

Even still, she would like to restock the bookshop in preparation for the second school term. She is applying for a loan of 107,300 Kenya shillings to purchase books, pencils, pens, manila paper, rubber erasers and rulers for sale. Ruth believes this will help her educate the children.

loans.use: To purchase books, pencils, pens, manila paper, rubber erasers and rulers.

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel is 29 years old and married with one kid. Madel works very hard to provide for the family.

Madel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Madel has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Madel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Glenda Grace

texts.en:
Glenda Grace works hard to support her family. Glenda Grace has two children in school and a picture frame lamination business in the Philippines.

Glenda Grace requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like plastic covers, wood, glue, etc.

Glenda Grace has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Glenda Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like plastic covers, wood, glue, etc., for her picture frame lamination business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 48-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has nine children. The oldest child is 24, while the youngest is 5. She is engaged in farming. She grows rice. She has been growing rice for 15 years. Her husband is a tricycle driver. Since his income is not enough to finance her farming business, Virginia requested a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizers. In the future, Virginia would like to expand her farming business to support her family as well as to finance her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Williamson

texts.en:
Williamson lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for four years. In this business, he sells retail stock, e.g. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. He also owns rented houses and a motorcycle for transport.

Williamson learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the high cost of products. 

Williamson is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve on the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Doung

texts.en:
Doung is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of five children who resides with her family in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Being a widow and responsible mother, Doung has been engaged in a farming business for more than 30 years now and this is the sole source of their income. Doung dreams of expanding her farming business because she realizes that the income from rice husbandry now is not enough to cover their expenses.

This will be her second loan she will take to help her son who decided to leave home to work as a construction worker in the neighboring country of Thailand. She is applying for the loan to pay for traveling fees and other expenses of her son. With this, her son will be able to work and earn a higher wage in Thailand, thus augmenting their profit and income.

loans.use: to pay for traveling fees and other expenses of her son.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
She sells food (goat meat) with the help of her family. Her first loan was very beneficial for her, since she was able to buy goats for her business. Before, she did not have enough capital to work with and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments on time.

She always struggles to improve her goat business, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Luvuno is requesting a loan to buy more goats for resale.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marites has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Marites aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yoly

texts.en:
Yoly works hard to support her family. Yoly is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Yoly requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like wood, paints, etc for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Yoly has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Yoly would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like wood, paints, etc for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 29 years old and married.

Janice works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, spices, eggs, etc.

Janice has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Janice aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Hog raising is the chosen business of Nida as her way of helping her husband in generating income for their family.  She is 51 years old and has six grown-up children. She and her husband aim to uplift their status of living in order to satisfy all their necessities and give their children a better life. She plans to improve her hog-raising business by asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the maintenance of her hogs. She is hoping that her loan will help her to make her business a profitable one.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: 3.9.283.10.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên works in the agriculture business farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Liên is 37 years old and married with two children. Liên is the group leader of the 3.9.283.10.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. Another child is grown up.

In 2012, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana is widowed and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing needs for her business.

Susana has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing needs for her business

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is from Samburu and has a farm with a dairy farm. She buys and sells goats to a slaughterhouse. She's married and has seven children, all of whom attend school.

She's a very hardworking and responsible person with more than three years of experience in this area. Thanks to her job, her family is getting ahead and they have everything they need.

She's requesting the loan to invest in her business by buying goats so she can continue to grow. She's grateful for this opportunity because it will help her grow and improve.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

She has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase toners, books, pencils, pens, manila papers, rubbers and rulers.

loans.name: 6 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE JUNIO” iniciará el trigésimo primero ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olimpia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de pan, tejido de chompas y manta, cafetería, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa de bebe.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olimpia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre y posteriormente decide  emprenderle independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que son responsables.
texts.en:
The "6 de junio" communal bank is beginning its thirty-first cycle with Pro Mujer in the Senkata office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which has Olimpia as president.  The members have different types of businesses, including: selling food, selling bread, knitting jumpers and blankets, a café, sellling make up and selling baby clothes.

This loan will benefit microentrepreneurs in Olimpia's group.  Olimpia tells us that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago, following an invitation from a friend who is a member of the bank.  Olimpia currently has a business selling food.  She says she learned to cook from her mother and later decided to turn this skill into her own business.

Olimpia will use this loan to increase her capital (buying rice, pastas, oil and more), which she will buy in the markets of El Alto city, and then later she will sell her products from her stall.  This type of work allows Olimpia to generate an income to pay for household costs.  Olimpia is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Olimpia responds that she likes how responsible they are.

loans.use: to buy rice, pastas, oil and more.

loans.name: 3.9.284.08.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hỡi has a retail business selling electronics. She is requesting a loan to purchase electronic devices to re-sell.

Hỡi is 48 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 3.9.284.08.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent and two others who are grown up.

In 2008, Hỡi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hỡi has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hỡi hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase electronic devices to re-sell.

loans.name: Mamacha Del Carmen-Vilcabamba Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Mamacha del Carmen” en la comunidad de Vilcabamba (La comunidad de Vilcabamba está ubicado en el del distrito de Caicay  dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco). Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican al agricultura, artesanía, ventad de comida, ganadería, crianza de animales menores y otros. 

Segundina está levantando la mano en la fotografía, ella tiene 23 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia, ella nació en la comunidad de Pitucancha pero actualmente está viviendo en la comunidad de Vilcabamba donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la agricultura pero tiene que alquilar terrenos de cultivos para sembrar maíz, ella es una persona responsable y sus vecinos no dudaron en invitarle a participar del banco comunal. En esta oportunidad Segundina requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y para alquilar un terreno de cultivo. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Made up of a group of neighbours and friends, the "Mamacha del Carmen" communal bank is in the Vilcabamba community.  (Vilcabamba is in the district of Caicay in the Paucartamba province of the department of Cusco):  This communal bank is made up of various members who are always looking for opportunities to move forward and to provide a better future for their children.  The members work in agriculture, artisan crafts, selling food, cattle raising, raising young animals and other activities.

Segundina (with her hand raised in the photo) is 23 years old and has one son.  She is responsible and friendly and is helping her family to prosper.  Segundina was born in Pitucancha but is now living in Vilcabamba where she works in agriculture.  However, she must rent land in order to grow her corn.  Segundina is responsible and her friends had no hesitations when they invited her to join the communal bank.  On this occasion, Segundina needs a loan to buy seeds and to rent land for growing her crops.  The whole group is grateful for the opportunity being provided and promises to make their repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to hire land to grow crops.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is a 59-year-old farmer and a sari-sari store owner from the community of Ubay, Bohol. In her store she sells basic household commodities like canned goods, sugar, seasoning and toiletries. She also has farmed rice with her husband for a living for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings, as well as toiletries for her store.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and toiletries.

loans.name: José Ovidio

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Es una persona muy humilde, pero con una gran responsabilidad y respeto a sus vecinos. Aprendió el trabajo de agricultor desde que era un niño, debido a que sus padres no lo enviaron a la escuela, siempre estuvo ocupado en las tareas de jornalero. Él vive en las faldas de un cerro, las calles son muy difíciles de transitar son inclinadas, lo que hace que don José traslade los insumos en su espalda hasta el lugar en donde cultiva.  Para ir a comprar los insumos, camina veinte minutos a  pies hasta llegar a la carretera en donde aborda un autobús viejo que hace el recorrido en treinta minutos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 8 sacos de fertilizantes, dos galones de herbicidas, 50 libras de semilla de maíz, entre otros insumos; para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000  metros cuadrados de fríjol. Por vivir en una zona de difícil acceso a él se le dificulta estar viajando a comprar los insumos por poquitos, por eso el crédito le será de gran ayuda; ya que dispondrá de los insumos para aplicarlos en el tiempo y cantidad correcta. Su deseo es brindar el estudio a sus hijos y construir una casa de ladrillo ya que en la que vive es de varas de tuguilote con arcilla.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old.  He has a partner and three children.  He is a humble man but has great responsibilities and a lot of respect for his neighbours.  He has been learning to work the land since he was a child, as his parents never sent him to school; José was always busy working as a labourer.  José lives on a hillside, where the steep incline of the streets makes it difficult to cross.  José carries supplies on his back, over to the land he works.  In order to buy his supplies, José must walk twenty minutes to the main road where he then takes a thirty minute bus ride.

José is applying for a loan from "Fundación Campo" in order to buy eight bags of fertiliser, two gallons of herbicides, 50lb of corn seeds and more supplies in order to grow 14,000m2 worth of corn and 7000m2 worth of beans.  Living in an area which has little access means that it is difficult to travel and only buy supplies in small quantities.  This loan will be a great help as he will have the necessary supplies to use at the correct time, and in the correct amount.  José wants to provide his children with an education and to build a brick house, as he currently has a home built of wood and clay.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of fertiliser, two gallons of herbicides, 50lb of corn seeds and more supplies in order to grow 14,000m2 worth of corn and 7000m2 worth of beans.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Roselyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
For the past few years, Bintiali has operated a real estate business to support her family and pay school fees. Her potential customers are tenants from the neighboring community and also villagers from her place of residence. She dreams of obtaining more real estate in the future and to be a leading business woman in the area.

Bintiali thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support. With the loan she wants to buy more paints and roofing sheets to renovate her buildings, which will attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy more paints and roofing sheets to renovate her buildings which will attract more clients.

loans.name: Agath's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 19 Avril 2004. Il est constitué de femmes du même quartier et qui entretiennent de bonnes relations. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Oumy est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 07 enfants dont 02 garçons et 05 filles. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète des cochons de lait ( 10 à 13 environs) à 15 000 frs l'unité, les élève pendant un certain temps avant de les revendre à 25 000 frs l'un. Elle va utiliser 100 000 frs à 150 000 frs pour l'achat de nourriture et l'entretien des porcs. 

Les bénéfices générés seront utilisés pour s'occuper de la maison (acheter de la nourriture, la scolarité des enfants) et renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du Bv.
texts.en:
The group was founded April 19, 2004. It consists of women from the same neighborhood who have a good relationship. Their main activities are trading and fattening livestock.

Standing to the right of the photo and raising her hand, featured member Oumy is 38 years old. She is married and has seven children of whom two are boys and five are girls.

With the loan received she will buy piglets (around 10 to 13) for 15,000 francs apiece, She then raises them for a while before selling them at 25,000 francs each. She will use 100,000 to 150,000 francs for the purchase of pig food and for maintenance.

Profits generated will be used to take care of household needs (buy food, pay for children's schooling) and strengthen her savings with the local "Banc Villageois" loan association.

loans.use: buy pigs she raises and sells

loans.name: Djiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  Djiguissème 1 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Foh, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et  Adama  debout en troisième position de la gauche vers la droite, compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 450.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Djiguisseme 1 group are married men who on average are 37 years old, with two children, all living in traditional families in Foh, one of the villages of Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They cooperate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution and past loans have been repaid in full.

The crop they have selected is corn and Adama, standing third from left to right, will use the loan to buy inputs, seeds and pay labor to maintain 7.5 acres.

Production is sold after harvest at the Sikasso village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

He expects to achieve an average profit of 450,000 FCFA per growing season.

This profit will allow him to pay off his loan and also help the enlarged family with daily expenditures.

loans.use: Buy inputs, seeds and pay for plowing

loans.name: Dolores Román

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 63 años de edad, es casado. Desde hace varios se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas; oficio que aprendió de sus padres. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a ordeñar sus vacas y luego se prepara para irse al terreno a trabajar durante toda la mañana y por la tarde trabaja como jornalero en las fincas. Para ir a comprar los insumos, camina tres kilómetros a  pies hasta llegar a la carretera en donde aborda el autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, abono y para pago del Aguilar del terreno en donde cultivara. Con la inversión tendrá la posibilidad de que su cosecha sea mejor para que sus ingresos le permitan cubrir los gastos de su familia. Él piensa comprar más vacas para producir más leche y tener otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Dolores, 63, is married. For several years, he has made a living in agriculture, a profession which he learned from his parents. He wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to milk the cows, and afterwards he gets ready to go to the fields to work all morning. In the afternoons, he works as a day laborer on the plantations. To buy supplies, he walks three kilometers to reach the road where he gets on the bus.

He has applied for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer, manure, and to pay rent for the land where he cultivates his crops. With this investment, he will be able to have a better harvest, so that his earnings allow him to cover his family's expenses. He plans to buy more cows to produce more milk and have another source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay rent for the land which he will cultivate.

loans.name: Machac Qhantati Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MACHAC QHANTATI”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de papa, producción y venta de hortalizas, tienda de barrio, producción de papa y chuño, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de enlatados, fideo, azúcar, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que el cobro lo realicen en su pueblo. 

Al grupo acompaña una señora que esta vestida con sombrero blanco y pantalos violeta.
texts.en:
The "Machac Qhantati" communal bank is entering its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional hub. This group is made up of ten members and is run by a board of directors, of which Nancy is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include the production and sale of potatoes, the production and sale of vegetables, a neighborhood store, the production of potatoes and potato starch, and the sale of livestock.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Nancy. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago by the invitation of one of the institution's promoters, who visited her at home. Her business is a neighborhood store. She says that she started this business on her own initiative upon observing the needs of her neighbors.

This loan will allow her to increase her working capital by buying canned goods, noodles, sugar, etc., which she will acquire from markets in the city of El Alto. After making her products, she will sell them in her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her household as much as possible, since she is married with three children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes that they take collections in her town.

In the photo, the group is accompanied by a woman wearing a white hat and purple pants.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rodrigo Alberto

texts.es:
Rodrigo tiene 29 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio de la minutaría. Aprendió desde muy joven; ya que su madre trabajo vendiendo minutas y fue así como le enseño a él como preparar el jarabe y hacer buenas minutas. Él no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a la pobreza en que viven, por ello decidió emprender el negocio que le enseño su madre para tener un medio de subsistencia.  Sale de su casa todos los días a las 6:00 a.m. a comprar el hielo, insumos para preparar el jarabe, entre otros productos que necesita, el viaje tarda unos veinte minutos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una motocicleta que será utilizada para vender las minutas y expandir su negocio. Él tiene que movilizarse a grandes distancias hasta las escuelas de la zona para vender las minutas a los niños, por eso requiere de otra moto y empleara a una persona para que le ayude. Su propósito es mejorar sus ingresos para que sus hijos asistan a la universidad y comprar un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Rodrigo, 29, is in a common-law marriage and has two children. He has ten years of experience in the snow cone business. He learned about this business from a young age because his mother made a living selling snow cones. She taught him to prepare the syrup and make good snow cones. He did not have the opportunity to study because they live in poverty. Therefore, he decided to start his own business, as his mother taught him, in order to have a means of subsistence. He leaves his house every day at 6:00 a.m. to buy ice and ingredients to make the syrup, among other products which he needs. The journey takes about twenty minutes.

He has applied for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a motorcycle, which he will use to sell the snow cones and expand his business. He has to travel great distances to the area's schools to sell snow cones to the children. Therefore, he needs another motorcycle and he will employ another person to help him. His goal is to improve his income so that his children can go to university, as well as to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle which he will use to sell snow cones and expand his business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman, and has been in the business for more than three years. This is the source of their income; Glenda works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

Glenda is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm and eventually, her harvest. 

In the future, Glenda dreams of expanding her venture so it will continue to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: 06.3.5 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan has a manufacturing business making wine; she has been involved in this business for more than ten years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to cook rice wine to sell.

Lan is 48 years old; she is married with two children who are her dependents. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in the Thanh Hoa province.

Lan is the group leader of the 06.3.5 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid her previous loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes her family can be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase rice to cook rice wine to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya.  He is married and owns a barber shop.

Peter learned about Milango through advertisements, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. 

He is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase shaving machines and related chemicals/cosmetics for the barber shop. His main challenge is the lack of financing, a problem he sees partly resolved by this loan. 

Peter believes the business will improve enough to meet the required repayments for the loan.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines and chemicals/cosmetics for his barber shop.

loans.name: Nahor

texts.en:
Nahor, 54, is an elementary school teacher and is married to Yanse, 54. They live with their four children: Dethan, 27, who just graduated from the university, Ester, 16, who is in the first grade of senior high school, Sandra, 13, who is in the second grade of junior high school, Judi, 10, who is in fourth grade of elementary school and Esto, 8, who is in second grade in elementary school.

Nahor realizes that his income as a teacher in a small village is not sufficient to cover all his children’s needs, so he plants fruit and vegetables on a plot of land. He grows mandarin oranges, sweet potatoes, and bananas. He also plans to cultivate red beans and peanuts, but has used all his savings to pay for his children’s fees. Therefore, he is applying for a loan from TLM totaling IDR 4,500,000 to purchase bean seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for his crops. 

He hopes he can cultivate it soon, then it can sold in the market.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds, fertilizer, and  insecticide for his crops.

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es: candelario de 61 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol  tiene mas de 27 años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, Candelario se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abonos, fertilizante y mejorar su terreno que muestra la fotografia para seguir con sus cosechas. confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena
texts.en:
Candelario, 61, lives with his wife and children. He makes a living cultivating corn and beans. He has worked in agriculture for more than 27 years, so he has plenty of experience in this field. He is very well-known in his area and he has a good clientele because he obtains the best harvests. Therefore, he sells a top quality product at accessible prices, and his service is unbeatable. 

Candelario is characterized by his great kindness. He is an enterprising man who is eager to succeed. He would like to increase his production, but he needs support, so he has applied for a loan from INTEGRAL. This will allow him to buy seeds, manure, and fertilizer and to improve his land, which is shown in the photo, so that he can continue with his harvests. He believes that he will be able to pay back his debt, and at the same time he will be able to give his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, and herbicide, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and married with one child. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a variety store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store. 

Evelyn has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money for the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: 06.6.5 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. An is 48 years old; she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in the Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, as her children are grown up.

An has a retail business selling clothes; she has been involved in this business for five years. An is the group leader of the 06.06.5 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to sell; this is An's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship An faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, An hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Obreras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS OBRERAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de camas, venta de cosméticos, venta de pantalones, venta de ropa, venta de calzados, venta de tenis, venta de ollas, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes  es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados; mismo que inicia hace años atrás al observar el progreso que tenían sus amigas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calzados) que adquirirá de  los comerciantes por mayor, de la ciudad de El Alto, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Hormiguitas Obreras" communal bank is entering its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional hub. This group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Lourdes is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include the sale of beds, cosmetics, pants, clothing, footwear, sneakers, pots, and CDs.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Lourdes. She says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, which she joined by the invitation of a consultant who visited her at home. She currently has a business selling footwear, which she started years ago after observing the progress her friends had made.

This loan will allow her to increase her working capital by buying footwear from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto. She will later sell the footwear from her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her household as much as possible, as she is single with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loans and the health initiatives.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze hails from the town of Samburu. She is 40 years old and is married to Mwangolo. She has 5 children, all of whom attend school.

Mbodze is an entrepreneurial lady who works in the community where she raises goats and later resells them. She is a strong-spirited, hardworking lady who has spent her life working hard to provide the best that she can for her family.

She is applying for this loan to buy livestock to raise so that she can continue working and helping her family. She is very happy with the support provided by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Mauro Adán

texts.es:
Mauro tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Toda su vida a trabajo mucho y se ha conservado con una gran fortaleza de joven. Él a trabajado en el cuido de ganado y en la agricultura desde que era un niño; sus padres le enseñaron, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a su situación económica. Para llegar al terreno en donde tiene sus cultivos, él se traslada en su caballo por calles con pendientes muy altas ya que esta cerca de un cerro. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizantes, 50 libras de semilla de maíz, entre otros insumos para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Como él vive en una zona con difícil acceso, se le complica el estar viajando tan seguido en busca de los insumos agrícolas. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo ya que en la que vive es de adobe para vivir más seguro junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Mauro is 64 years old, married and has four children. He has worked a lot his whole life and has been able to remain as strong as a young person. He has been working with agriculture and cattle since he was a kid, taught by his parents. He could not attend school because of the lack of money. The piece of land where he works is located on a hilltop, so he must ride his horse on steep roads in order to go to work.

Mauro is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy six bags of fertilizer, fifty pounds of corn seeds and other supplies needed to grow corn in a 14,000 m2 piece of land. He lives in a remote area, so it is difficult for him to travel on a frequent basis to buy agricultural supplies. Mauro’s dream is to build a brick house, since the one where he lives now is made of adobe. This way, he and his family will have a safer place to live in.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizer, fifty pounds of corn seeds and other supplies.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  Djiguissème 2  sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Foh, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et   N’Tio debout au milieu, compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 700.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of Djiguissème 2 Group are married men who average 40 years of age and five children. All live in traditional families in Foh, a village in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming business during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth loan from the MFI. The previous loans were repaid without problems. Their crops include corn. 

N’Tio is the man standing in the middle in the photograph. He intends to use his loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay for plowing, in order to maintain five hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising both men and women. N'Tio intends to turn an average profit of XOF 700'000 (ca US$ 1'400) per farming cycle.

This profits will enable him to repay the loan and help him cover the daily expenses of his large family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: 06.01.12 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên has a retail business selling shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase shoes to resell. Liên has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

Liên is 46 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent and the 3 others are grown up.

Liên is the group leader of the 06.01.12 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liên has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to resell

loans.name: Djiguisseme 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  Djiguissème 3  sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Foh, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et   Nafo debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite, compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of Djiguissème 3 Group are married men who average 40 years of age and five children. All live in traditional families in Foh, a village in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming business during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth loan from the MFI. The previous loans were repaid without problems. Their crops include corn.

Nafo is the man standing on the left in the photograph. He intends to use his loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay for plowing, in order to maintain two hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising both men and women. Nafo intends to turn an average profit of XOF 300'000 (ca US$ 600) per farming cycle.

This profit will enable him to repay the loan and help him cover the daily expenses of his large family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is 38 years old. She lives in Banoja village, Tskaltubo district, with her husband Niko and two children who are going to school. Zeinab requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Her family has a mini-bus. Zeinab’s husband, Niko, is driving it on a bus line and earns a monthly income, which is the only source for the family.

Zeinab requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Zeinab has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With her credit, Zeinab will build a greenhouse. She will purchase all the needed materials for building it and also tomato and green seeds. After growing the products, Zeinab will have a good harvest. Harvested products will be sold locally at the markets and she will earn an additional income for her family. Increased income will help her to provide better living conditions for the family and future studying for her children.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Aserbastian

texts.en:
Aserbastian lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has three school-going children. He sells horticultural produce; e.g. mangoes, plums, passion fruits, oranges, etc. He has been operating this business for ten years. Apart from this business he also earns a salary from formal employment.

He learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to better his business operations. The main challenge he faces is the high cost of farm produce. 

Aserbastian is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy more fruits for resale. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business, open other branches and pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a responsible mother who is aiming for a successful life for her family.  She is 38 years old and has five children who are all studying.  She and her husband wanted to improve their business to support the education of their children. For this reason, Raquel engages in selling food snacks to generate additional income. 

She wants to sell more kinds of snacks in the local community but she has limited capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP8,000 to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, bananas, hot  dogs, barbecue and other ingredients needed in cooking snack foods to sell. She is hoping that someday she will be able to improve the business and make it profitable.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, bananas, hot dogs, barbecue and other ingredients.

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala is a fish vendor from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children. Her husband works as a fisherman. Gonzala is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and also new fishing nets. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and her earnings from fish vending. 

In the future, Gonzala dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for their needs. Also, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and also new fishing nets.

loans.name: Falex

texts.en:
Falex lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya.  He is married and has two school-going children. He owns a service shop which deals in clothes laundry. He also sells maize.

He learned about Milango through a friend, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge comes when customers' clothes get burnt or lost. He has to pay for such problems

Falex is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy soaps and iron boxes and also to add maize stock. He believes that the business will improve well enough to meet the required repayments for the loan.

loans.use: To buy soaps and iron boxes and also to add maize stock.

loans.name: Akio

texts.en:
Akio is from Samburu. She is 46 years old and married with seven children. They live in their own home. Two of the children are already grown-up, have jobs, and are independent. 

Akio has run a store for over three years, which is going very well, because she says that she has a loyal customer base thanks to her excellent service, in addition to being the best-stocked store in the neighborhood. This combination of factors means that she is enjoying lots of success.

She dreams of being able to continue to grow, so that she earns enough to help her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting this loan to buy drinks, sugar, rice, flour and other items, as these are the best-selling products. She is grateful for the help she is receiving. It will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, rice, flour and other items.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Thanks to the effort and hard work of Mjeni, her business has expanded. She now has steady clientele because of the good and friendly service she provides her customers.

Mjeni is requesting a loan to purchase 10 bags of charcoal and other products. She is happy because of the opportunity provided by Kiva lenders and Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is a 32-year-old man from Homabay Town in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Zipporah, who is a business lady, and he has two children who are 6 and 1 year old.

He sells fish at the market, a business he has been doing for the last 13 years. He makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has applied for his second loan with KADET Ltd., which he will use to purchase a new motorbike to help in running his business. He will use the anticipated profit to pay back the loan and increase the value of his stock.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his business.

loans.name: Delusila

texts.en:
Delusila, who is a 27-year-old assistant teacher, lives with her husband, Adi, who works for a private organization. Delusila works in a vocational school and wishes to become a fully certified teacher. However, in order to become qualified, Delusila must earn a diploma in education. 

While she needs funds to pay for her education, she and her husband are also building a small home for their family. Delusila has requested a loan from TLM for IDR 7,500,000 to pay for her college expenses and use the remaining amount to pay for the completion of the house.

loans.use: to pay for her college expenses and use the remaining amount to pay for the completion of a house.

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en:
Otgontsetseg, 33 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Last year, she began working as a conductor at a train station. Before this job, she was looking after her children by staying at home. Her husband is currently unemployed and looking after his children. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,200,000 MNT to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. This automobile will be used by her husband for a taxi service and contribute to her family's income. Her salary and the earnings from the taxi service will surely increase their income. The borrower is a hardworking individual who strives for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang Province, Mao is 45 years old and married. 

The common business among her neighbors in her residential area is rice farming. She also manages a five-hectare area to grow rainy season rice as the main source of income. To better feed the family, her husband also works for others for a fee for extra income. The five years involvement in the current business has returned her about 26,100 KHR per day.  

This is the second loan for Mao with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) while her co-borrower is the first-time client. She has used her first loan wisely to uplift her living condition at a good pace. Now, she is seeking 1,200,000 KHR while her co-member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can earn a higher yield than before.

loans.use: To buy potash and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Tsevegsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsevegsuren is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on her father's land. She has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2010. Her husband has a position of assistant worker at a building company. During winter, construction work stops and he renders taxi service for a living. 

This year the family decided to grow vegetables for their own sustenance, and to sell for a profit. Tsevegsuren is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase potato seeds. In autumn, they will harvest their potatoes and sell them to vendors at a wholesale price. 

Also, growing vegetables contributes to the efforts against air pollution by converting carbon dioxide into oxygen through the process called photosynthesis. The borrower is a hardworking individual who wants to invest in her children's future education.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has five children, three of whom attend school. He owns a bookstore, a business which he has been operating for five years. Besides this business, John earns some income as a college tutor.

He learned about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is competition from similar businesses.

John is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase graduation gowns which he will rent out on occasions. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family. His plan for the future is to open a nursery and primary school.

loans.use: To purchase graduation gowns to rent out.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Diala is a 33-year-old single woman who has been working in clothes selling for three years. In April 2012, she started her own business to increase her income and develop her living. She is a hardworking woman. 

She used to work as an accountant, too, but she was attracted to clothes sales more. She wanted to take the challenge and find out how much she could expand her business and increase her income.

She is well known in her region, and with her good reputation and hard work, she is also known for her competitive prices and the quality of products provided to customers. 

Diala is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her merchandise with a special summer collection and competitive prices. She is very excited about this loan, and she is sure that it will bring a very positive impact on both her social and financial situations.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a special summer collection and competitive prices.

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
Thon, a resident from the Moung Russey district in the province of Battambang, is a 41 year-old woman who is blessed with four children. Three of her children are still in school. 

For her family’s sake, Thon grows rice on three hectares of land as a source of their income. Her husband provides support also. After 10 years of being involved in her current business, she is able to earn up to 21,700 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan for Thon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully paid back, gradually enabled her to support her business and earn a living. Now, she is the leader of a group of three to apply for a new loan.
