The total amount of her group loan is 1,800,000 KHR of which 200,000 KHR is her loan portion. Thon will use her loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to boost her crop output so that she can make more money to sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Nimrezzi

texts.en:
Nimrezzi has a fish-selling business, which she has operated for more than four years. She says seasonality is her main business challenge. She also operates a business selling firewood. Nimrezzi dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 30,000, Nimrezzi would like to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates the help.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Pheoun's Group

texts.en:
Phoeun is 54 years old and a widow. She resides in the Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province. She counts on a single business, rice farming, to support the family’s sustenance. She has been involved in the current business for 14 years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she and other three joint members in the same group are in their third loans. She has managed to use her past loans wisely to improve her family’s living status and relieve its burden. Now, she is seeking 600,000 KHR; this is the same amount as her joint members. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed and pigs to raise for extra income. She hopes to raise her pigs healthily and sell them at high prices so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Kakvey's Group

texts.en:
Kakvey, a married mother of four children, is a rice grower from Battambang province where her residential area is. Her rice farm covers a one-and-a-half-hectare area. 

With 10 years' engagement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 32,500 KHR per day. Kakvey has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five cycles and has completely repaid her past loans, which have upgraded her living status gradually and provided decent daily food for her children. 

For this cycle, she forms a group of six to apply for a new loan. Two members including her are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each, while the remaining four members are seeking 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland and to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland. She hopes that she can triple her yield so that she can improve her living at a good pace.

loans.use: To plow her farmland and to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is 43 years old and she is happily married to Frankline. God has blessed them with loving children who are all still studying. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well, and they are helping each other by working for their family.

Rowena owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community. The store is connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, an egg or other items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to make a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. She earns about Php300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of Php15,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help in aiding her to add more products to her store.

Rowena’s dream is to have a supermarket someday, and she hopes that her family will always be happily together. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mockline

texts.en:
Mockline lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a greengrocery, a business which she has been operating for five months. Mockline is also formally employed, and she sells charcoal, too. She sells tomatoes, sugar and onions, etc. in this business.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are bad debts and the high cost of transport while sourcing for the goods. Even then, she believes she can overcome them. 

Mockline is applying for a loan of 63,850 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal, vegetables and fruits at wholesale prices. She will improve her lifestyle from the extra income.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, vegetables and fruits at  wholesale prices.

loans.name: Bunthoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Bunthoeurn is 30 years old and a single man from Battambang province, where rice farming is the common business in the area. Not different from his neighborhood, he also does rice cultivation on a 1.5 hectare area. He is able to earn up to 33,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business that he has been with for five years. 

Buntheourn, a seven-time borrower, formed a group of two with a second-time borrower in order to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has wisely utilized his past loans and has fully repaid them with success. The past loan has enabled him to support his business on time and return him a decent profit, better than last year. 

Now, he and his joint member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. For Bunthoeurn as the leader, he will spend his loan portion to pump water and buy potash for his rice field. He hopes to earn more income so that he can set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: To pump water and buy potash for his rice field.

loans.name: En

texts.en:
A young mother of one little child, En is 25 years old and a rice grower and a bamboo vendor residing in Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. With three years' engagement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 16,800 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for En with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy a plot of farmland to grow more rice and buy more bamboo for resale. She hopes to earn more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to grow more rice and buy more bamboo for resale.

loans.name: Thim's Group

texts.en:
A peasant from the Bovel district of Battambang province, Thim is 22 years old and has one small child to care for. She depends on corn growing as her main source of income. To supplement the family’s income, her husband works for others for a fee. The current business has returned her about 33,200 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Cambodia), Thim is in the first cycle loan. She leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. The total amount of her group loan is 4,000,000 KHR. Thim, whose loan portion is 1,500,000 KHR, will spend it on plowing fees, corn seed, potash, and insecticide purchasing. She hopes that she can earn more income so she can set aside some money as a reserve to send her child to school.

loans.use: To spend on plowing fees, corn seed, potash, and insecticide.

loans.name: Kimhun's Group

texts.en:
Kimhun, 24 and a mother of one little son, is a local citizen from the Bovel district of Battambang Province. 

For sustenance for the family, she grows corn on a five-hectare area with support from her husband. She has engaged in the current business for four years. 

This is the first microloan for Kimhun's group, consisting of two female members who are applying for 1,500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for fertilizer, insecticide, seed, and plowing fees. She hopes to earn a high corn yield and make more income to improve her living.

loans.use: To fertilizer, insecticide, seed, and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Herminia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: agricultura, venta de ganado porcino y ovino, venta de comida, venta de ganado vacuno, elaboración de colchones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Herminia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de colchones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña al ayudar a su madre y al casarse decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a los comerciantes que venden por menor. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The ‘Nuevo Amanecer’ (New Dawn) communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Focal Center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Herminia is the president.  The members’ business activities are varied and include farming, selling pigs and sheep, selling food, selling cattle, and making mattresses.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Herminia is a member.  She says that this is the first time she has been a part of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who went to visit Herminia at her house.  She currently has a business making mattresses.  She explains that she learned this business when she was a young girl helping her mother.  When Herminia got married she decided to undertake the business independently.

The loan that she will now take is to increase capital (to buy fabric) that she will get at the stores in the city of El Alto.  After making the mattresses she will sell them to the wholesale merchants.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible.  She is married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings about health and loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: 02130603 Thôn Hiệp Thành _Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huê operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase meat for resale. 

Huê is 50 years old, and she is married with four children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 02130603 Thôn Hiệp Thành _Hoằng Kim solidarity group. Three of her children are grown up, so Huê supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Huê's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Huê has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Huê hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase meat for resale.

loans.name: Chanleak's Group

texts.en:
Chanleak, 35, is married and has three children. She is a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support her living, she does rice farming and corn growing as the main source of family income. She has been involved in the current business for 10 years. 

Chanleak is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan was the first loan with VisionFund. She has completely repaid her past loan with success, and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle in a gradual manner. 

Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. The total loan amount of her requested loan is 3,600,000 KHR (Cambodian riels). As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for labor. She hopes that she will gain a good yield, better than last year's.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
For 15 years now, Editha has been farming rice for her family's needs. She and her family live in Ubay, Bohol. She has nine children, ages 9 to 25 years old. Editha is asking for a loan to buy  fertilizer and seedlings to maintain her farm. This will keep her crops healthy and will assure a better yield every four months.

In the future, she hopes to grow her farm and cultivate more land to make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak, 56 years of age, is a mother of eight children, six married children and two single children who live with her in Prey Chor district and always help her in farming. Prak owns and operates a farming business, from which she can earn approximately 10,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) each day. She uses the income for basic necessities for her family. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to KHR 2,000,000 to purchase farming materials to apply on her crops. With this loan, she will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other materials needed to improve her farm. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will further improve her business as well as her living status.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials to apply on her crops.

loans.name: Savour's Group

texts.en:
Savour, age 42 and married, is a local villager from Battambang province. She has four children, two of whom still rely on her as they are still in school. Four hectares of rice crops are her main source of income; it's the business which she has been with for 20 years. 

Including this loan, she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loan cycles. She has managed to provide decent food for her kids from the decent income received from the positive impact of her past loan, which she has fully repaid. Now, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR (Cambodian riels). She leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland. She hopes to improve her living conditions, better than before.

loans.use: to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Chhoeurt's Group

texts.en: An inhabitant from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Chhoeurt is married and blessed with two children. He is a carpenter who makes wooden tables, cabinets, beds, and other furniture as the main source of his income. To earn extra income, he also catches fish for resale. He has been involved in his current business for ages. Chhoeurt has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. He is now partnering  with another first-time borrower to apply a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy necessary materials to support both of his businesses. He hopes to earn more income to sustain his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials to support both of his businesses.

loans.name: Somarin's Group

texts.en: A 51-year-old widow from the Sangke district of Battambang province, Somarin is a vendor who sells grilled chicken in order to support her two out of six children, as they are still in school. She has been engaged in her current business for three years. She and her partner are the second-time borrowers with VisionFund Cambodia. She feels confident that she can improve her living status gradually after the past loan which she has repaid with success. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR, the same loan amount as her partner is requesting. She will spend her loan portion as a leader to buy more chicken to grill and resell. She hopes to earn more income so that she can expand her business and upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to grill and resell.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
For the past years, Zainabu has operated a cosmetic shop as well as a food stall, selling from home. This provides her another source of income. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of cosmetics and food for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of cosmetics and food for resale.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Yungaqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE YUNGAQUI II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria ella es casada y tiene 31 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de leche y queso, la socia vende en las diferentes ferias y también vende en el mercado, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene en este negocio 8 años y le va muy bien, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta preparar tortas para sus hijos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar queso y leche.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ganados, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers are members of the communal bank “Inmaculada Concepción de Yungaqui II”, located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

Thirty-one year old Gregoria is a member of the bank and is married with 2 children. She works selling milk and cheese at different festivals and markets. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. She has been running this business for 8 years and it has been going very well. During her free time she likes to prepare pastries for her children. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cheese and milk. The other members' businesses include selling animals, selling cattle, a grocery store and farming. 

Gregoria thanks those who form a part of this dream by way of this loan and she is committed to making her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy cheese and milk.

loans.name: Aníbal Isaí

texts.es:
Aníbal tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Aprendió el oficio de la agricultura desde la edad de los 10 años; ya que tenía que ayudar a su padre en las labores agrícolas. Para llegar al terreno en donde tiene sus cultivos tiene que caminar dos kilómetros y transportar los insumos en caballo. Cuando es la siembra de maíz los transporta en estacones de madera ya que por las altas pendientes del terreno no se puede utilizar tractor o bueyes; pero sus cosechas son igual de buenas que en los terrenos planos.  

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, aborda un autobús en su comunidad en las faldas de un cerro de ahí viaja unos treinta minutos hasta                               

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizantes, un galón de herbicidas, 50 libras de semilla de maíz, entre otros insumos para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. La inversión le ayudara para que su cosecha tenga los insumos a tiempo y en la cantidad apropiada para obtener buenos resultados y poder construir una casa de ladrillo para que sus hijos vivan mejor.
texts.en:
27-year old Aníbal is married and has two children. He’s been involved in agriculture since he was 10 years old as he had to help his parents work their land. To get to the fields where he grows his crops he has to walk two kilometres and carry supplies on horseback. When he plants the corn, he transports it on wooden stakes as the steep slopes make it impossible to use either a tractor or oxen. His harvest is just as good as that from flat fields.

When Aníbal needs to buy supplies for his farm, he travels 30 minutes by bus from his hillside community.

The loan he is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy six bags of fertilizer, a gallon of herbicide, 50 pounds of corn seed, and other supplies for his 14,000 m2 land. The money will help him obtain the necessary supplies in time and in sufficient quantities to ensure a good harvest. He will also be able to build a brick house so that his children can live more comfortably.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, seeds etc for his farm

loans.name: Ismaelita

texts.en:
Ismaelita is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is from San Miguel, Bohol, and she is engaged in retail sales of cosmetics and fashion accessories to the people in her area. This is the source of her income. 

Ismaelita is asking for a loan to buy more cosmetics and fashion accessories to sell to her customers. With this loan, she will be able to sell more and earn more. In the future, Isamelita hopes to make her business sustainable and a success.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and fashion accessories to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jose Hilario

texts.es: Don jose de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa propia, don jose es un hombre trabajador y responsable, desde hace varios años se dedica a la produccion y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado y ajustar para la compra de una vaca lechera que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita
texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old and lives with his wife and child in his own home. Jose is a hard-working and responsible man. For many years, he has worked in the production and sale of milk products in the area where he lives. He has a good clientele since he has known how to gain the confidence of his customers. He offers quality and good prices for his products.

He has decided to invest in the care of his livestock since his business depends on that. Because of this, he has applied for a loan to be able to buy vitamins for the livestock and adjust for the purchase of a milk cow that will allow him to grow his business. With this, he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue providing economic help to his household, which needs it so much.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins for livestock and to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis has been involved in agriculture for 16 years. He keeps chickens and grows peaches, plums, strawberries, apples, and pears. He gets income by growing gillyflowers and selling it to  the local flower resellers. 


This agricultural income is very important for Sargis to sustain the family of six: Sargis, his parents, his wife, and two children.

Realizing that agriculture is the only source of his income, Sargis would like to expand his agricultural activities. He has requested this loan to purchase chickens and special forage for feeding them. This will enable him to gather more income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for chickens and special forage for feeding them.

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Carlos  está en su ciclo número  13 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual es una herramienta que permite conocer a las personas su situación en todas sus dimensiones. En este grupo, tres de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, por lo que se están esforzando por salir adelante.
La Sra. Feliciana tiene 43 años se dedica a la cría de animales para vender y también para su consumo. Ella tiene una pequeña granjita en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, cuida a sus animales y ve que no les falte nada. Sus hijos pequeños le ayudan para cuidar y vender, y de esa forma la familia entera pone mucho esfuerzo por salir adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, como ser afrecho, avezan y maíz, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y dando a sus crías lo que necesita. Agradece por esta ayuda que le ayudará a seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The San Carlos group, a committee of women, is in its 13th cycle in the program.  They are doing an inquiry into the elimination of poverty, which is a tool that allows them to get to know all dimensions of a person's situation.  In this group, three of them are below the poverty line, and because of this they are working hard to get ahead.

Feliciana is 43 years old and works in raising animals to sell and also for consumption.  She has a small farm where she works each day starting very early.  She cares for her animals and makes sure they aren't lacking anything. Her small children help her to care for them and sell them, and in this way the whole family exerts a lot of effort to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy feed for her animals, which will be bran and corn, with which she will be able to continue working and giving her animals what they need.  She is thankful for this help that will allow them to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals, like bran and corn.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
Laureana nació en la comunidad de Pitumarca(Cusco, Peru) pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 
Laureana tiene 47 años de edad y es casada de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de refrescos y ropa, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad donde vive. Ella en sus horas libres también se dedica a la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, colorantes artificiales, frutas y otras cosas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Laureana was born in the Pitumarca (Cusco, Peru) community but now lives in the city of Salvación. The city of Salvación is located in the district of Manu in the province of Manu within the department of Madre de Dios, Peru.

Laureana is 47 years old and is married with four children. She is a hard working and entrepreneurial mother who is moving her family forward. Her main economic activity is the sale of soft drinks and clothing. She has a small stand in one of the markets of the city where she lives. She always spends her free time working in agriculture. She has had this business for several years and sees that it is going very well for her thanks to the perseverance that she puts forth in her work. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Tesoritos del Manu" (Little Treasures from Manu) and needs a loan now to buy supplies including sacks of sugar, artificial colorants, fruits and other items. She is thankful for the loan and values its worth. She is committed to paying her monthly loan installments.

loans.use: to buy supplies including sacks of sugar, artificial colorants, fruits and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y ganaderia,la socia se dedica al negocio de venmta de verduras y frutas,animales menore y chicha de jora que es una bebida a base de maiz,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y leva muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar sus pequeños negocios.La socia solcita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su tierras de cultivos.

La socia agracede a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Aurelia continues working in the business of agriculture and livestock. She works in the business of selling of vegetables and fruit, young animals, and chicha de jora, which is a corn-based drink. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Aurelia has already worked for 7 years in this business and it goes well for her. Aurelia’s dream is to grow her small businesses. She is applying for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cultivated land. 

Aurelia is thankful to those who make up a part of this dream through this loan and promises to complete her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her cultivated land.
